Detailed Description

High level EC packet TAGs handler class.

Member Function Documentation

bool CECTag::AddTag ( const CECTag &  tag,
CValueMap *  valuemap = NULL 
)

Add a child tag to this one.

The tag argument is reset to an empty tag.

Be very careful that this method swallows the content of tag, leaving tag empty. Thus, the following code won't work as expected: 

 {
    CECPacket *p = new CECPacket(whatever);
    CECTag *t1 = new CECTag(whatever);
    CECTag *t2 = new CECTag(whatever);
    p->AddTag(*t1);
    t1->AddTag(*t2);    // t2 won't be part of p !!!
 }

To get the desired results, the above should be replaced with something like:

 {
    CECPacket *p = new CECPacket(whatever);
    CECTag *t1 = new CECTag(whatever);
    CECTag *t2 = new CECTag(whatever);
    t1->AddTag(*t2);
    delete t2;  // we can safely delete the now empty t2 here, because t1 holds its content
    p->AddTag(*t1);
    delete t1;  // now p holds the content of both t1 and t2
 }

Then why copying? The answer is to enable simplifying the code like this:

 {
    CECPacket *p = new CECPacket(whatever);
    CECTag t1(whatever);
    t1.AddTag(CECTag(whatever));    // t2 is now created on-the-fly
    p->AddTag(t1);  // now p holds a copy of both t1 and t2
 }
Parameters:
tag a CECTag class instance to add.
Returns:
true if tag was really added, false when it was omitted through valuemap.

Referenced by CStatTreeItemTotalClients::AddECValues(), CStatTreeItemMaxConnLimitReached::AddECValues(), CStatTreeItemReconnects::AddECValues(), CStatTreeItemRatio::AddECValues(), CStatTreeItemAverageSpeed::AddECValues(), CStatTreeItemAverage::AddECValues(), CStatTreeItemTimer::AddECValues(), CStatTreeItemPacketTotals::AddECValues(), CStatTreeItemPackets::AddECValues(), CStatTreeItemCounterMax::AddECValues(), CStatTreeItemUlDlCounter::AddECValues(), CStatTreeItemCounterTmpl< _Tp >::AddECValues(), CStatTreeItemSimple::AddECValues(), CStatTreeItemPeakConnections::AddECValues(), CStatTreeItemRateCounter::AddECValues(), CamuleRemoteGuiApp::BootstrapKad(), CECPacket::CECPacket(), CStatTreeItemBase::CreateECTag(), UpdatableItemsContainer< SearchFile, CEC_SearchFile_Tag, uint32 >::ProcessUpdate(), and CamuleRemoteGuiApp::UpdateNotesDat().

CECTag & CECTag::operator= ( const CECTag &  tag  ) 

Copy assignment operator.

std::vector uses this, but the compiler-supplied version wouldn't properly handle m_dynamic and m_tagData. This wouldn't be necessary if m_tagData was a smart pointer (Hi, Kry!).
